revised_title: Spin-Dependent Rotational Energy Transfer in Open-Shell Collisions
tldr: The authors develop a theory for rotational energy transfer in collisions between open-shell molecules and atoms, focusing on the spin-exchange interactions and their influence on the process. They discuss the consequences of exchange interactions on the spin states during inelastic collisions and present a scattering theory approach to calculate scattering cross-sections for spin-independent and spin-correlated cases. The study is relevant to understanding processes in the upper atmosphere and interstellar space.
